intro: Neurolaena serboana, commonly known as the redroot false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its roots are often reddish in color, which gives it its common name. Neurolaena serboana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
